Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
Provides data fields and methods to create a Player in the Tic-Tac-Toe game. Can check if the player has won and prompt the player when it is there turn.
Since:
2020-02-02
Version:
1.0
Author:
William Ledingham

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void makeMove()
    Prompts user for row and column input and adds mark to the board.
    void play()
    Checks for player win and passes turn to opponent.
    void setBoard​(Board theBoard)
    Set the board for this player.
    void setOpponent​(Player opponent)
    Set the opponent for this player.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • play

      public void play() throws java.io.IOException
      Checks for player win and passes turn to opponent. Calls makeMove() and displays board.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove() throws java.io.IOException
      Prompts user for row and column input and adds mark to the board.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • setOpponent

      public void setOpponent​(Player opponent)
      Set the opponent for this player.
      Parameters:
      opponent - Player object to be set as the opponent player.

    • setBoard

      public void setBoard​(Board theBoard)
      Set the board for this player.
      Parameters:
      theBoard - Board object to be set as playing board.
